channel.title: Mean people
channel.description: I think that most new people on here are really badly treated. It seems anyone with 10 - 20 rep gets treated like shit because they don't have 200 rep. People call them idiots and expect absolute shit from them just because they're new to the site. I think it's really mean because you don't even know them, so how can you judge them? You just see some guy with 10 rep and you think, "That guy's an idiot nothing he says matters" when really he could be smarter than anyone on this site. This is just my opinion though. Please don't get mad at me or flame me for writing this... But do post your opinions on it, please.

item.title: Mean people
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Ix Soulcist xI:

You would be surprised at the amount of people with 200 Reputation are flamed. I seem to find people not using the correct Grammar expectations are flamed the most, and the people whom don’t bother using the search bar.

If you can’t help your self first, why should we bother helping you?

I don’t see why all the new members complain about their questions not being answered, Most if not all questions in the help section are either not in the right section, not server or client related, not following the board rules, show that they did nothing to figure it out on their own, didn’t even try the search bar, didn’t even read the tutorial correctly, or act like they know what their talking about when they didn’t even answer the question correctly and then start a flame war, or even the OP acting like a dick when a person tells them their wrong.

Renegade715:

lol yeah seeming that alot of 200 rep-ers xferr the rep anyway to try and look pro… real members just show people what they are capable of and will be respected for that ^^.

I am lost in your sentence…

Read full topic

item.title: Mean people
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

TC, considering your post, I’m guessing you find a lot of people with 200 rep either idiots or assholes, right? Well, that does seem to apply to some of them, but really, rep has become meaningless over the past year. It used to be a lot different getting rep, you actually had to do something legitimately helpful or make a real, non-C&P tutorial that can actually benefit others’ servers to get it. It took me over a year to get my 200 rep, and that was usually for being nice to people and helping out when I could. Now rep is just thrown around and has lost all of if not most of its meaning here on MPSC. Why? All it takes is one person to give rep to a newcomer who finds absolutely every little things helpful, and then it continues on and on and on.

Until the majority of Moparscape’s community can actually be mature and the newcomers realize how it works around here, rep will mean nothing, there will be flame wars, there will be a lot of things wrong, most of which you probably see all the time.

Read full topic

item.title: Mean people
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:14, topic:374618”]If people didn’t just come here to A) get 200 rep, b) get a massive post count, c) troll, d) ask stupid questions and not read the rules. Then the older members wouldn’t bash them. The person should be compident enough to read the rules of the section their posting in and making sure they know what their talking about before they post something.[/quote]Most of my rep came for a shitty application and the rest for no reason, Rep only somehow counts if your on MITB as all newfags will be treated like shit. Except by one person I know.

Read full topic

item.title: Mean people
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

My only criticism is that so many people moan about members asking “dumb questions”, questions that can be answered with the aid of google but yet I have seen dozens of intelligent questions completely ignored and left to die.

The most moronic topics on this forum seem to thrive with other members repeating the answer a million times, flaming the op or simply spamming the topic.

Read full topic

item.title: Mean people
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote="† Kane †, post:13, topic:374618"]I kinda get it now.

IMO people that can’t figure out something that easy really don’t deserve respect, no matter how they ask it.

1 - They can use search bar or Google
2 - It’s like, the easiest thing to do
3 - I think there is a tutorial on that

Anyways, I’m always open to help people, no matter how dumb they may be. Not all people learn as fast as everyone else.[/quote]
Its not their intellect we worry about, its not the ‘able to’ factor, its the ‘trying to’ that comes into play. As long as someone has tried and researched a little bit, then we have no issues. If they just come on here and ask blunt questions (I asked questions, but I tried as well). How newcommers are treated is because of their ‘trying to’ efforts in the first few posts.

Read full topic

item.title: Mean people
item.dc:creator: @_Kane † Kane †
item.description:
@_Kane wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:11, topic:374618”]Granted, the search feature does kinda blow. I agree, but it’s still better to say something like:

“Hey guys, I’m not sure how to change player rights. I’ve googled and found out they are 1,2, and 3, 3 being admin. Is 3 the owner? I’ve attempted it on my server and it is admin, I’m just confused.”

rather than

“HOW I MAKE MYSELF OWNER”[/quote]

I kinda get it now.

IMO people that can’t figure out something that easy really don’t deserve respect, no matter how they ask it.

1 - They can use search bar or Google
2 - It’s like, the easiest thing to do
3 - I think there is a tutorial on that

Anyways, I’m always open to help people, no matter how dumb they may be. Not all people learn as fast as everyone else.

Read full topic

item.title: Mean people
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

You remind me of myself. When I was like 12 and was coming here, I really wanted to help people. Over the years you grow sick of seeing the same questions, and all the attitudes of others rub off on you and eventually you just start flaming because in your mind, you automatically think the victim is an idiot and can’t do any good.

Read full topic
